newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong gold ends unchanged after two-way trade.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong gold ends unchanged after two-way trade.

text.p: Hong Kong gold ended unchanged on Thursday from its overnight New York finish after a day of lacklustre two-way trade, gold market sources said.
Bullion ended at US$369.10/60 an ounce, unchanged from New York's close on Wednesday. "There was some shortcovering but things were pretty flat," said one gold dealer.
Physical demand remained average, dealers said.
Christmas holidays had diluted turnover, and volumes remained thin in afternoon trade, dalers said.
Local gold ended HK$1 lower at HK$3,408 a tael.
The carry over charge at the Chinese Gold and Silver Exchange Society fell to -4.00 from its previous close at -6.00.
